trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory hybrid identity design considerations - determine directory synchronization requirements | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory hybrid identity design considerations - determine directory synchronization requirements | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Identify what requirements are needed for synchronizing all the users between on=premises and cloud for the enterprise.
trans-unit.target: Identify what requirements are needed for synchronizing all the users between on=premises and cloud for the enterprise.

trans-unit.source: Determine directory synchronization requirements
trans-unit.target: Determine directory synchronization requirements

trans-unit.source: Synchronization is all about providing users an identity in the cloud based on their on-premises identity.
trans-unit.target: Synchronization is all about providing users an identity in the cloud based on their on-premises identity.

trans-unit.source: Whether or not they will use synchronized account for authentication or federated authentication, the users will still need to have an identity in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Whether or not they will use synchronized account for authentication or federated authentication, the users will still need to have an identity in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: This identity will need to be maintained and updated periodically.
trans-unit.target: This identity will need to be maintained and updated periodically.

trans-unit.source: The updates can take many forms, from title changes to password changes.
trans-unit.target: The updates can take many forms, from title changes to password changes.

trans-unit.source: Start by evaluating the organizations on-premises identity solution and user requirements.
trans-unit.target: Start by evaluating the organizations on-premises identity solution and user requirements.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements for how user identities will be created and maintained in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements for how user identities will be created and maintained in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For a majority of organizations, Active Directory is on-premises and will be the on-premises directory that users will by synchronized from, however in some cases this will not be the case.
trans-unit.target: For a majority of organizations, Active Directory is on-premises and will be the on-premises directory that users will by synchronized from, however in some cases this will not be the case.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Do you have one AD forest, multiple, or none?
trans-unit.target: Do you have one AD forest, multiple, or none?

trans-unit.source: How many Azure AD directories will you be synchronizing to?
trans-unit.target: How many Azure AD directories will you be synchronizing to?

trans-unit.source: Are you using filtering?
trans-unit.target: Are you using filtering?

trans-unit.source: Do you have multiple Azure AD Connect servers planned?
trans-unit.target: Do you have multiple Azure AD Connect servers planned?

trans-unit.source: Do you currently have a synchronization tool on-premises?
trans-unit.target: Do you currently have a synchronization tool on-premises?

trans-unit.source: If yes, does your users if users have a virtual directory/integration of identities?
trans-unit.target: If yes, does your users if users have a virtual directory/integration of identities?

trans-unit.source: Do you have any other directory on-premises that you want to synchronize (e.g. LDAP Directory, HR database, etc)?
trans-unit.target: Do you have any other directory on-premises that you want to synchronize (e.g. LDAP Directory, HR database, etc)?

trans-unit.source: Are you going to be doing any GALSync?
trans-unit.target: Are you going to be doing any GALSync?

trans-unit.source: What is the current state of UPNs in your organization?
trans-unit.target: What is the current state of UPNs in your organization?

trans-unit.source: Do you have a different directory that users authenticate against?
trans-unit.target: Do you have a different directory that users authenticate against?

trans-unit.source: Does your company use Microsoft Exchange?
trans-unit.target: Does your company use Microsoft Exchange?

trans-unit.source: Do they plan of having a hybrid exchange deployment?
trans-unit.target: Do they plan of having a hybrid exchange deployment?

trans-unit.source: Now that you have an idea about synchronization requirements for your company, you need to evaluate the applications that use these directory services.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have an idea about synchronization requirements for your company, you need to evaluate the applications that use these directory services.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements to integrate these applications to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is important to define the technical requirements to integrate these applications to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Will these applications be moved to the cloud and use the directory?
trans-unit.target: Will these applications be moved to the cloud and use the directory?

trans-unit.source: Are there special attributes that need to be synchronized to the cloud so these applications can use them successfully?
trans-unit.target: Are there special attributes that need to be synchronized to the cloud so these applications can use them successfully?

trans-unit.source: Will these applications need to be re-written to take advantage of cloud auth?
trans-unit.target: Will these applications need to be re-written to take advantage of cloud auth?

trans-unit.source: Will these applications continue to live on-premises while users access them using the cloud identity?
trans-unit.target: Will these applications continue to live on-premises while users access them using the cloud identity?

trans-unit.source: You also need to determine the security requirements and constraints directory synchronization.
trans-unit.target: You also need to determine the security requirements and constraints directory synchronization.

trans-unit.source: This evaluation is important to get a list of the requirements that will be needed in order to create and maintain user’s identities in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This evaluation is important to get a list of the requirements that will be needed in order to create and maintain user’s identities in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Where will the synchronization server be located?
trans-unit.target: Where will the synchronization server be located?

trans-unit.source: Will it be domain joined?
trans-unit.target: Will it be domain joined?

trans-unit.source: Will the server be located on a restricted network behind a firewall, such as a DMZ?
trans-unit.target: Will the server be located on a restricted network behind a firewall, such as a DMZ?

trans-unit.source: Will you be able to open the required firewall ports to support synchronization?
trans-unit.target: Will you be able to open the required firewall ports to support synchronization?

trans-unit.source: Do you have a disaster recovery plan for the synchronization server?
trans-unit.target: Do you have a disaster recovery plan for the synchronization server?

trans-unit.source: Do you have an account with the correct permissions for all forests you want to synch with?
trans-unit.target: Do you have an account with the correct permissions for all forests you want to synch with?

trans-unit.source: If your company doesn’t know the answer for this question, review the section “Permissions for password synchronization” in the article [Install the Azure Active Directory Sync Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn757602.aspx#BKMK_CreateAnADAccountForTheSyncService) and determine if you already have an account with these permissions or if you need to create one.
trans-unit.target: If your company doesn’t know the answer for this question, review the section “Permissions for password synchronization” in the article [Install the Azure Active Directory Sync Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn757602.aspx#BKMK_CreateAnADAccountForTheSyncService) and determine if you already have an account with these permissions or if you need to create one.

trans-unit.source: If you have mutli-forest sync is the sync server able to get to each forest?
trans-unit.target: If you have mutli-forest sync is the sync server able to get to each forest?

trans-unit.source: Make sure to take notes of each answer and understand the rationale behind the answer.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to take notes of each answer and understand the rationale behind the answer.

trans-unit.source: [Determine incident response requirements](active-directory-hybrid-identity-design-considerations-incident-response-requirements.md) will go over the options available.
trans-unit.target: [Determine incident response requirements](active-directory-hybrid-identity-design-considerations-incident-response-requirements.md) will go over the options available.

trans-unit.source: By having answered those questions you will select which option best suits your business needs.
trans-unit.target: By having answered those questions you will select which option best suits your business needs.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Determine multi-factor authentication requirements
trans-unit.target: Determine multi-factor authentication requirements

trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.target: Design considerations overview
